sen.j: 細川 輝経（ほそかわ てるつね）は戦国時代 (日本)・安土桃山時代の武将。
sen.e: Terutsune HOSOKAWA was a Japanese military commander who lived from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) to the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 将軍足利義輝から偏諱を賜い、輝経と名乗る。
sen.e: He was granted a henki (one character of the name of a shogun or a daimyo) by the Shogun Yoshiteru (written as義輝 in Japanese) ASHIKAGA, and he began to call himself Terutsune (written as 輝経 in Japanese).

sen.e: He also served Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, a younger brother of Yoshiteru, and when Nobunaga ODA banished Yoshiaki from the capital, he and other vassals of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) accompanied Yoshiaki all the way to Tomo, Bingo Province in the Chugoku region.

sen.e: He was appointed to be the defense general of Kumihama-jo Castle in Tango Province, but he was commanded to commit seppuku after the battle due to a suspicion of secret communication with the Western Camp.
